name: Carry Me
description: Carry Me by Dan Berry is a beautiful, wordless, and incredibly affecting visual metaphor for love, fear, life and death. A man carries his infant daughter through an overgrown field where they are pursued relentlessly by a growling dog. Illustrated by Berry’s loose pen and lush colour washes, Carry Me is a sublime example of pure visual storytelling. Book personalisations are available on this title. Please select the option from above. 28 pages, full colour. First Printing - November 2013 Also available as an eBook.

name: Dangeritis: A Fistful of Danger
description: Danger has a new name. It's Derek. Follow the misadventures of low-budget super-spy Derek Danger as he somehow gets into an explosive battle with an army of ninjas when warming a microwave pasty at the local petrol station. Created by Warwick Johnson-Cadwell (Tank Girl) and Robert Ball (Winter's Knight), they create each page in turn, ramping up the danger and piling on the jokes then leaving it to the other to carry on the story. Dangeritis is an hilarious, energetic, techni-colour romp and the perfect reminder of how much fun comics can be. 52 pages, full colour. First Printing - November 2013 ISSN 2054-2186 Also available as an eBook.

name: Hitsville UK #2
description: Hitsville UK #2 continues the pop art, surreal, musical soap opera following the adventures of the weirdos and wannabes of indy record label, Hitsville UK. What does drug-addled producer Greg Pastis have in store for the angel voiced grotesque Gwillum? Why are The Carrie Nation’s Revenge hunting bequiffed vampires? And will The Dreadnoughts escape the Nazi Frankenstein’s Monster? All this madness and more in the second issue of Hitsville UK by John Riordan and Dan Cox. 36 pages, full colour. First Printing - November 2013 ISSN 2052-8620 Also available as an eBook.

name: Tall Tales & Outrageous Adventures: The Snow Queen & Other Stories
description: Tall Tales and Outrageous Adventures: The Snow Queen and Other Stories is the first in a new series of fairytale adaptations by Isabel Greenberg. In this first issue Greenberg retells Hans Christian Andersen’s ‘The Snow Queen’ and ‘The Emperor’s New Clothes’. Taking a playful, modern approach to these classic tales and illustrated in Greenberg’s charming, folk art inspired style Tall Tales… will delight readers old and young alike. Book personalisations are available on this title. Please select the option from above. 32 pages, full colour. First Printing - November 2013 ISSN 2053-759X Also available as an eBook.

name: Show Me The Map To Your Heart & Other Stories...
description: Show Me The Map To Your Heart & Other Stories is a collection of stories from John Cei Douglas ranging from nostalgic coming of age tales to long distance relationships, being stranded on a desert island, coping with mental health problems and the childlike wonder of exploring fantasy worlds. The title story, which features a fold out map, revolves around a folk tale romance and quest of self discovery. ...makes us look at our own relationships and the ways they change our lives. Richard Bruton - Forbidden Planet International Featuring four of the finest pages ever in comics, this is a black, white and decidely blue collection of meticulously composed short stories. Stephen L. Holland - Page 45 36 pages, one colour/b&w litho offset. First Printing - November 2013 ISBN 9780957431881 Also available as an eBook

name: Great Beast Autumn Release Bundle - LIMITED OFFER
description: For a limited time you can buy all of Great Beast's Autumn releases in one simple transaction with discounted shipping. You will get one physical copy of each of the following comics... Carry Me by Dan Berry Dangeritis: A Fistful of Danger by Warwick Johnson-Cadwell and Robert Ball Hitsville UK #2 by John Riordan and Dan Cox Tall Tales and Outrageous Adventures: The Snow Queen and Other Stories by Isabel Greenberg Show Me The Map To Your Heart and Other Stories by John Cei Douglas Please note that personalised books are not available in the bundle. Your order will go out week commencing the 2nd of December 2013.

name: Blood Blokes Bundle
description:
Buy the first three issues of Adam Cadwell's cult comic books series Blood Blokes at a special price.

Blood Blokes is a Northern slacker vampire comedy following Uni drop-out Vince as he discovers that living forever requires something to live for.

Issues 1 and 2 are 24 pages, issue 3 is 26 pages, all B&W.
ISSN 2049-4165

name: Hitsville UK Bundle
description:
Buy the first two issues of John Riordan and Dan Cox's cult comic book series Hitsville UK at a special price.

Hitsville UK is a pop art, surreal, musical soap opera following the adventures of the weirdos and wannabes of indy record label, Hitsville UK.

Both issues are 36 pages and full colour.
ISSN 2052-8620

name: Hitsville UK # 1
description: Meet has-been record-label boss, Gerry Corden and drug-addled maniac, producer Greg Pastis as they assemble the acts for their new label. Cue an angel voiced grotesque, a mystery solving teen gang, a schoolboy DJ haunted by robots, Nazi-punk-zombies and more. Hitsville UK is a stained love-letter to the weirder corners of pop music. The best, though possibly the only, musical-pop-art-soap-opera in comic book form. Each page is a rush of playful artwork, shifting styles fast and loose to match each genre of music, with the jokes coming quick and sharp. Full of sly digs and references to musical genres past and present Hitsville appeals to music obsessives as much as comic fans. “A bloody great accumulation of inspired madness, musical insanity and general chaos… a pure, unadulterated hit of a comic” -Richard Bruton - Forbidden Planet International “A perfect three minute chemical-infused rush of a comic” – Comic Heroes magazine 36 pages, full colour. Second Printing - July 2013 ISSN 2052-8620

name: Winter's Knight: Day One
description: Winter’s Knight is a wordless tale of an old Knight on a mysterious personal quest through an icy wilderness encountering nightmarish battles with the dark things in the forest and much, much worse. Sublimely depicted by Ball’s sharp and elegant shapes and his deft use of striking colour, each scene drips with emotion and atmosphere. This is feast of rich imagery which draws you in to this icy world and demands multiple readings. Book personalisations are available on this title. Please select the option from above. “This is all about the narrative driven by the art, pacing delivered through the beautiful pictures. …A wonderful blanket of a world, icy cold, blood red, all utterly stunning.” – Richard Bruton, Forbidden Planet International. 48 pages, full colour. Second Printing - June 2013 Also available as an eBook.

name: Winter's Knight: Day One - Digital Edition
description: Please note that you are buying the digital version of Winter's Knight - Day One. For the print copy, please click here. Winter’s Knight is a wordless tale of an old Knight on a mysterious personal quest through an icy wilderness encountering nightmarish battles with the dark things in the forest and much, much worse. Sublimely depicted by Ball’s sharp and elegant shapes and his deft use of striking colour, each scene drips with emotion and atmosphere. This is feast of rich imagery which draws you in to this icy world and demands multiple readings. “This is all about the narrative driven by the art, pacing delivered through the beautiful pictures. …A wonderful blanket of a world, icy cold, blood red, all utterly stunning.” – Richard Bruton, Forbidden Planet International. 48 pages (incl. covers), full colour, PDF format, 8MB.

name: Ellerbisms
description:
The cult autobiographical web-comic is finally released in a handsome collection from Great Beast Comics. Ellerbisms is the story of a relationship told in pictures through the autobiographical comics of Marc Ellerby. Ellerbisms catches a glimpse into the life of a young couple, their highs and lows, their sighs and LOLs. Ellerbisms collects more than 200 original strips plus an additional 30 pages of brand new material exclusive to this edition. Why not get your copy personalised or add an extra mini comic to your order?

  • A standard edition with signature (dedication optional) for £12.99

  • A personalised edition with a signature and original hand drawn illustration for £17.99

  • A standard edition with signature as well as a copy of Hourly Comics (which collects all of Marc Ellerby's autobio hourly comics in one edition) for £15.99

  • A personalised edition with signature, illustration and a copy of Hourly Comics for £20.99


Please inform us of your dedication and/or illustration request in the Note To Seller option on checkout.

268 pages. 152mm x 229mm. Black and white interiors, full colour cover. ISBN: 978-0957431805 Released November 2012

name: Ellerbisms - Digital Edition
description: Please note that you are buying the digital version of Ellerbisms. For the print copy, please click here Ellerbisms is the story of a relationship told in pictures through the autobiographical comics of Marc Ellerby. Ellerbisms catches a glimpse into the life of a young couple, their highs and lows, their sighs and LOLs. Ellerbisms collects more than 200 original strips plus an additional 30 pages of brand new material exclusive to this edition. You can also buy the eBook from the following retailers (prices vary on external sites) comiXology iTunes/iBooks (must be read on a iOS device) Kindle - UK | US Digital edition ISBN: 9780957431836 268 pages (incl. covers), black and white interiors, PDF format, 113MB.

name: Chloe Noonan: Monster Hunter Digital Omnibus
description: Chloe Noonan is a monster hunter, but she doesn't have any powers. She can't beat up bad guys, she can't run without getting a stitch. She's kinda flakey and really not bothered about saving the world. Especially when she has to get the bus everywhere. This digital omnibus collects every Chloe Noonan story to date in full colour and comes complete with a cover illustration gallery, fan art section and a look into my sketchbook designs. Preview here! Reviews "One of my favourite titles, small press or other-wise" - Comics Heroes "Chloe Noonan represents the potential of independent comics in the UK better than anything else" -Starburst "Simply one of the best comics I’ve read in the last few years, and you need to be reading it." -Forbidden Planet International Great Beast edition May 2012. 136 pages. 178mb.

name: Chloe Noonan: Monster Hunter #4 - Colour Special
description: Chloe Noonan is a monster hunter, but she doesn't have any powers. She can't beat up bad guys, she can't run without getting a stitch. She's kinda flakey and really not bothered about saving the world. Plus she has to get the bus everywhere. I know, right?! This special issue sees our hero take on her biggest threat yet: the weekly student indie disco. But all is not what it seems. Joined as always by her BFF Zoe Fox and male-pal Doug, this special full-colour issue fits nicely into the three previous issues but as always is a perfect introduction to the characters and world of Ravensdale. Preview here! Book personalisations are available on this title. Please select the option from above. 24 pages, full colour. A5 First edition November 2011. ISSN 2049-6079

name: Chloe Noonan: Monster Hunter #2
description: Chloe Noonan is a monster hunter, but she doesn't have any powers. She can't beat up bad guys, she can't run without getting a stitch. She's kinda flakey and really not bothered about saving the world. Plus she has to get the bus everywhere. I know, right?! Issue 2 = fight issue! A brand new monster tries to ruin Chloe's day, which is impossible as she was never in a good mood to begin with. Will Chloe survive the day at college, let alone some big ol' nasty trying to mow her down. Preview here! Book personalisations are available on this title. Please select the option from above. 32 pages, black and white. Great Beast edition May 2012. ISSN 2049-6079

name: Blood Blokes 'Chiroptera' Print
description:
A limited edition run of 50 risograph prints signed and numbered by the artist.

Seven species of bat (mammals of the order Chiroptera) have been studied and intricately illustrated by the world renowned*, natural science illustrator** A. Cadwell. The perfect gift for budding naturalists, art collectors, great big goths or friendly neighbourhood vampires.

A3 size. 29.7cm x 42 cm.
Black and red ink on 300gsm, recycled white paper stock.

* This is a lie.
** This is another lie.

name: Blood Blokes #3
description: A 6 issue series about slacker vampires sharing a house in Manchester. For Vince an eternity with nothing to do sounds ideal until he actually gets it and finds living forever requires something to live for. In this issue, Vince awakens in the vampire house with more than a few questions. When he discovers the hard way that going home isn't an option he finds the life of a vampire to be alarmingly familiar, yet Vince still longs for a certain someone. Featuring illustrations by Tula Lotay, Priscilla Tramontano, Josceline Fenton and Sammy Borras. Reviews: "You have never read a vampire comic remotely like this, but you really, really should." - Stephen L Holland, Page 45 “Blood Blokes is an unmissable milestone in the UK’s re-emergence as a world leader in comics.” - P M Buchan, Starburst Magazine 26 pages, black and white. 1st printing, May 2013. ISSN 2049-4165

name: Blood Blokes #2
description: A 6 issue series about slacker vampires sharing a house in Manchester. For Vince an eternity with nothing to do sounds ideal until he actually gets it and finds living forever requires something to live for. The second issue introduces Mike, Douglas and Arianna, three vampires who spend most of their time arguing about the blood buying rota until Mike witnesses a strange death on New Year's Eve which leads them all into even weirder territory. 7 page preview here. Reviews: "You have never read a vampire comic remotely like this, but you really, really should." - Stephen L Holland, Page 45 “Blood Blokes is an unmissable milestone in the UK’s re-emergence as a world leader in comics.” - P M Buchan, Starburst Magazine 24 pages, black and white. 1st printing, July 2012. ISSN 2049-4165

name: Blood Blokes #1
description: A 6 issue series about slacker vampires sharing a house in Manchester. For Vince an eternity with nothing to do sounds ideal until he actually gets it and finds living forever requires something to live for. The first issue introduces Vince, a young University drop-out with no ambition, who has the worst and last day of his life, and things only go downhill from there. 7 page preview here! Reviews: “Blood Blokes is an unmissable milestone in the UK’s re-emergence as a world leader in comics.” - P M Buchan, Starburst Magazine "With its feet set firmly on the Mancunian ground it’s like none other [vampire comic] you’ve ever seen before… This is a revelation." - Stephen L Holland, Page 45 "This is some debut... a class start." - Richard Bruton, Forbidden Planet Eagle Award nominee for ‘Favourite British Comicbook: Black & White’ 2012. 24 pages, black and white. 1st printing (Great Beast edition), February 2012. ISSN 2049-4165

name: The Everyday
description: Great Beast is pleased to announce the definitive collection of Adam Cadwell's autobiographical web-comic, The Everyday. The Everyday cherishes the fleeting moments of our day to day to create an honest and hilarious portrait of modern life and the many little miracles and mysteries within. This book collects for the first time all 200 comic strips for the acclaimed web-comic at the size they were drawn and includes an introduction by the artist and a foreword by Matthew Sheret. Order options - A standard edition with signature (dedication optional) for £11.99 - A personalised edition with a signature and original hand drawn illustration for £16.99 Please inform us of your dedication and sketch preferences in the Note To Seller option on checkout. Digital Edition available here. Hardback, 224 pages. 216mm x 155mm, Landscape. Black and white interiors, full colour covers. ISBN: 978-0957431843 Released November 2012. If you are interested in purchasing original artwork from the book please get in touch using the contact form.

The Everyday cherishes the fleeting moments of our day to day to create an honest and hilarious portrait of modern life and the many little miracles and mysteries within. This book collects for the first time all 200 comic strips for the acclaimed web-comic at the size they were drawn and includes an introduction by the artist and a foreword by Matthew Sheret. Digital edition ISBN: 978-0957431850 228 pages (incl. covers), black and white interiors, PDF format, 93MB. Released November 2012.
